Evaluate evidence (portfolio artifacts) which support and provide evidence of obtaining expected learning outcomes. Determine the authenticity of portfolio evidence verifying the petitioner has meet the learning competencies of the course. Authenticity of evidence insures that credit award is based on learning, skills and products that the student does in fact possess or has produced.

Evaluate the breadth and quality of the learning and documentation represented in the portfolio as to meeting the learning outcomes expected in the course. Evaluate the degree to which the concept has been learned, whether that learning represents and is equivalent to the expectation of the course, and whether that learning meets all the criteria tests for acceptability.

183b290c-0942-4bc5-bf8b-68916dc828a1.description: The badge earner has mastered the skills needed to identify problems, formulate decisions while assessing alternative solutions and evaluate the outcomes of the suggested solution. The badge earner understand the principles of critical thinking and problem-solving, and applies the principles of critical thinking and problem-solving to identify problems, solve problems and evaluate the outcomes of suggested solutions.
183b290c-0942-4bc5-bf8b-68916dc828a1.name: Critical Thinking Expert Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Describe major theories and models of critical thinking and problem-solving. Assess and reflect on personal critical thinking and problem-solving styles. Execute problem-solving actions appropriate to solving a variety of simple and complex problems. Apply understanding of the typical barriers to critical thinking when problem-solving.
Pass Group Assessment: HOSA Creative Problem Solving Team Assessment (Resource 6) at 80% or higher
Earn 80% or higher on Application of Critical Thinking Steps (Resource 7)

Demonstrate safe and proper use of cutting tool selection, applications, and operation including wheel application, features/attributes, side/surface grinding, part loading (magnetic chuck) wheel dressing, and nomenclature. Demonstrate effective process planning, setup and operation to include: machine configuration, selection, operation sequencing, and work-holding concepts/devises, balancing/mounting grinding wheels, mounting/dressing magnetic chucks.

Apply correct operations such as deburring and part loading (vise/fixture). Apply inspection techniques to include: verification of angularity, with/out size, perpendicularity, position profile of a surface and surface finish. Identify shapes and symbols associated w/feature control frames.

16956f67-2c73-458d-91a1-bd1c297407c7.description: The badge earner has mastered the skills needed to use technical and informative writing using correct spelling, grammar, and formatting. The badge earner can explain the expectations of college-level academic writing, think critically about information, and recognize the ethical issues associated with using information.
16956f67-2c73-458d-91a1-bd1c297407c7.name: Information Literacy Expert Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize and articulate expectations of college-level academic writing. Understand the concept of information literacy and process of academic writing. Evaluate the reliability of information. Apply evaluation criteria to assess the quality of source types. Understand how to synthesize information. Describe principles of ethical use of information. Ensure all products are produced honestly and without plagiarism. Apply standards for safety, privacy, and confidentiality of health information.
Earn 80% or higher on mini Research Paper on topic of earner's choice
Pass Patient Confidentiality/HIPAA quiz at 80% or higher

eb21b535-6c5e-4e22-bf1d-ed852440d6eb.description: The badge earner has the skills needed for maintaining a connection to students and material between face to face and online. The earner promotes being equally active in both spaces. The earner is able to enhance learning by combining the application of theories to real world learning. This badge demonstrates the linking face to face and online environments.
eb21b535-6c5e-4e22-bf1d-ed852440d6eb.name: Instructor Presence Mastery

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Have one's course, course notes, and course maps audited to verify required competencies

Provides clear and explicit course requirements, including important due dates and time frames for learning activities. Communicate in a frequent, empathetic, positive and friendly manner. Establish and maintain a sense of community among the students.

528c83a6-1a73-4a9e-8062-543749d444d2.description: The badge earner has the skills necessary to thoughtfully incorporate offline and online data to gauge student learning and refine, adapt, and differentiate lessons based on that data. The earner provides transparency in grading and assessment policies so that all participants are clear about the intent and importance of each learning experience.
528c83a6-1a73-4a9e-8062-543749d444d2.name: Learning Analytics & Target Learning Mastery

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Have one's course, course notes, and course maps audited to verify required competencies. This includes an audit of the adaptations and changes journal for the course within the Instructor Notes module of the learning management system.

Apply learning analytics to monitor student progress; help students evaluate their own performance, and track course progress and completion. Use intelligent agents to provide learners with multiple opportunities to track their learning progress.

0a3fa521-20a3-4959-bdfe-02cfa29acd28.description: The earner of this badge has the foundational skills necessary to be an introductory machinist. The badge holder has foundational machining knowledge combined with modern techniques and skills to be successful in today's manufacturing industry.
0a3fa521-20a3-4959-bdfe-02cfa29acd28.name: Machining

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the following: Safety Skills, Measurement Skills, use of Manual Milling Machine, use of Manual Lathe, and use of Pedestal Grinders

014185e9-1a20-476e-bd06-4837bfba5f14.description: The badge earner has the skills and knowledge to successfully complete process planning, basic manual milling machining applications, machine set ups, operations, inspection techniques and safety standards.
014185e9-1a20-476e-bd06-4837bfba5f14.name: Manual Milling Skills One

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Earn NIMS Manual Milling Skills I certification issued by the National Institute of Metalworking Skills to signify passing the NIMS Manual Milling Skills I credentialing test

Safely and properly use cutting tool assembly, select tools, and prepare materials. Execute setup including configuration (LOC/EOH) fitting, holder/cutter applications, and cutter features/attributes. Effectively inspect cutters/holders, align vise/fixture, establish XY Zero from a hole/two surfaces. Demonstrate tramming, verification with/out size verification, hole gaging, and verification of parallelism, perpendicularity, position at MMC, surface finish and thread gaging.

Effectively process plan, including: machine configuration, selection, operation sequencing, and work-holding concepts/devises and material prep including bar stock sizes, cutting blanks and deburring. Effectively use machining applications/operations: drilling face/peripheral/plunge/slot milling, reaming, deburring and part loading.

91525c06-4768-4e11-ae44-c2b79abe4a37.description: The badge earner has mastered Essential Algebra competencies of algebraic operations, algebraic equations and formulas, and systems of equations.

Math-Fundamental Concepts and Operations of Algebra Mastery
Math-Systems of Equations Skills Badge
Math- Formulas and Variation Skills Badge
Math-Equations and Formulas Skills Badge
Math-Solving Quadratic Equations Skills Badge

db6027a3-f7ee-498d-a9b2-67797fc1180a.name: MSU-3D Scanning

The assessment of mastery is equivalent to an 80% or higher on a 100 point scale which accurately reflects the mastery of the competencies listed above. Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering & Engineering Technology.

6985a085-5254-4168-9c05-a764bf061657.description: The badge earner has the fundamental knowledge and specific skills to successfully complete composites process planning, composites repair techniques, damage control, tooling and progressive failure analysis for a laminate.
6985a085-5254-4168-9c05-a764bf061657.name: MSU-Composite Repair Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Pass randomized question assessment mastery at an 80% or higher. Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering & Engineering Technology

Understand structure, properties and characteristics of materials used in construction, maintenance and repair of aircraft components, whole structures and sub-assemblies. Apply knowledge of repair methods and tools. Identify composite defects. Correctly interpret and/or produce repair scheme/modification drawings/sketches. Prepare components for hot bonding. Differentiate characteristics of joining and bonding. Use common composite processes and techniques to repair composite material.

7bb83f55-eb85-4101-a2d2-5e0f54b0c3c1.description: The badge earner has the fundamental knowledge and specific skills of testing composites, concepts, principles, inspection and methods employed for both destructive testing and nondestructive evaluation (NDE) of composites structures and materials.
7bb83f55-eb85-4101-a2d2-5e0f54b0c3c1.name: MSU-Composite Testing Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Pass randomized question assessment mastery at an 80% or higher. Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering & Engineering Technology. Recommended test requirements include: identify properties to be measured according to specification; select appropriate test methods according to specifications; and select appropriate testing equipment according to standards and specifications.

Demonstrate and apply knowledge and characteristics of destructive and non-destructive testing techniques. Understand nondestructive testing technologies and their applications to composites materials. Apply quality control and quality assurance procedures in testing destructive and nondestructive testing and evaluation.

dfe340a8-3325-4a3e-916d-377dbf1caa8c.description: The badge earner has the fundamental knowledge and skills of design guidelines for metal additive manufacturing processes, part orientation, support structures, design optimization, overhangs, and residual stresses and warping.
dfe340a8-3325-4a3e-916d-377dbf1caa8c.name: MSU-Design for Metal Additive Manufacturing

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Pass randomized question assessment mastery at an 80% or higher. Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering & Engineering Technology

Design and print objects containing moving parts without assembly metal components. Identify the steps required to output, investigate and repair additive. Develop designs that leverage the strengths of metal Additive Manufacturing. Evaluate the various software tools, processes and techniques for metal additive manufacturing. Design and implement appropriate safety factors in part designed for Additive Manufacturing.

Utilizes the principles of "Design for Additive Manufacturing" to compare and contrast additive technologies with traditional manufacturing methods such as machining in terms of rate, quality, cost, and flexibility.

10d46c42-00c7-4dcb-8b39-d3f8ccff6c3b.description: The badge earner has the fundamental knowledge of composite materials in classifications, properties, design, fibers, matrices, manufacturing, material handling, safety and environmental requirements and selection of composite materials for engineering applications.
10d46c42-00c7-4dcb-8b39-d3f8ccff6c3b.name: MSU-Fundamentals of Composite Materials

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Pass randomized question assessment mastery at an 80% or higher. Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering & Engineering Technology

Distinguish between various classes of advanced composite materials. Apply the theory of anisotropic elasticity. Identify the characteristics of fiber/matrix interfaces. Calculate materials properties depending on the structure configuration and reinforcement orientation. Determine the appropriate manufacturing process for a new product based on engineering analysis of the product requirements, basic components characteristics and factory operations.
Identify the health, safety issues and environmental regulations that currently relate to a composites manufacturing facility ensure compliance to regulations.

9e966582-d8dd-4248-aaf8-78442fd00f3e.description: The holder of this badge has the skills and knowledge to successfully complete post processing, supply chain management, machine set ups, operations, powder manufacturing processes, alloys and material properties, inspection techniques and safety standards.
9e966582-d8dd-4248-aaf8-78442fd00f3e.name: MSU-Metal Additive Manufacturing Post Processing

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Pass an instructor graded assessment (at 80% or higher on a 100 point scale) created from a pool of randomized questions designed to accurately assess the mastery of the competencies listed below.  Information regarding the assessment can be obtained from MSU Department of Engineering and Engineering Technology.

Perform the appropriate steps to fabricate parts, from metal Additive Manufacturing machine set up to post processing and refinishing successfully. Apply correct post processing techniques with proper selection and type of process while maintaining the equipment.

Use Additive Manufacturing terminology properly and understand the role and importance of standards in the metal additive manufacturing industry. Determine the critical safety factors around Additive Manufacturing metal part production including personal protection equipment (PPE), facility safety best practices, material handling and disposal, and mitigating exposure and explosion risks.

570683ff-b8ef-4140-b905-09eedf609964.description: The badge earner has mastered the ability to identify key aspects of skills needed for professional success such as professional presentation, dressing for success, time management skills, and stress management techniques. The earner understands the the relationship between teamwork, group communication, and leadership in the workplace. The earner understands the professional role of values and ethics and has demonstrated proficiency in completing tasks needed to obtain a job.
570683ff-b8ef-4140-b905-09eedf609964.name: Personal Professional Responsibility Expert Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Colorado Community College System

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate an understanding of professionalism. Describe what makes a successful employee. Discuss the role of teamwork in the workplace, the role of group communication in establishing effective teams, and the role of leadership in the workplace.

Discuss how conflict can have both positive and negative impacts on the workplace. Diffuse conflict in order to maintain success in the workplace. Explain how values and beliefs systems impact character development. Understand and apply the principles of ethics. Describe stress and ways to decrease levels of stress.
Earn 80% or higher eon Research Paper (Resource 5)
Earn 80% or higher on Professional Portfolio
